snippet: Islamic State militants are reported to have launched offensives on two fronts — in the province of Hama and near Damascus, residents said.
abstract: Islamic State militants seize new territory in several areas of Syria, killing dozens of civilians and reasserting its power at time when government troops and other militant groups are vying for control; Islamic State's advance into Yarmouk district on southern end of Damascus represents closest group has ventured to the provincial capital.

byline.original: By ANNE BARNARD and HWAIDA SAAD
byline.contributor: Maher Samaan contributed reporting from Beirut; Rana F. Sweis from Amman, Jordan; and an employee of The New York Times from Damascus.

lead_paragraph: Islamic State militants are reported to have launched offensives on two fronts — in the province of Hama and near Damascus, residents said.

headline.main: ISIS Seizes New Territory in Deadly Attacks in Syria
headline.print_headline: ISIS Seizes New Territory in Deadly Attacks in Syria

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
